Reviews.Title: Wow, well worth the money!
Reviews.Author: Chris in Phoenix
Reviews.Content: I have several Android devices - phones and other tablets. I wanted a tablet for my daughter for Christmas; she is 8, and very tablet savvy (they use them at school, and also she uses mine). The pink case sold me on it, and the price (< $80 delivered). However, I was skeptical of the cost, and how functional it would really be.First off, it shipped very fast by USPS. It arrived within a few days. It was pristine. Along with the tablet was a screen protector, USB cable, charger, USB type-A adapter (which I assume is to connect USB devices such as flash drives and *maybe* keyboard - I plan to test both of these later today), earbud headphones and a decent (although unnecessary) stylus. Initially, I thought the screen was scratched, and not very responsive, but there is a protective plastic cover over it. Take that off, and put the screen protector on instead and it looks and works great. The capacitive touch is very good, especially considering the price.It has decent performance. It came right up on my office network, and worked flawlessly. Netflix streamed very smoothly. Video playback from Netflix and MP4 files I copied from my PC worked great. Audio playback was reasonable for a tablet, and sounded very good with headphones. Sound through the speaker with video and audio playback was fine (plenty loud). Skype worked fine also, as did various games I tried (Angry Birds and Fruit Ninja come installed). The Android app store came right up, and I had no problem downloading apps and music.By default, the tablet comes in USB storage device mode, which did not work with Windows 7 x64. Not sure why. I switched the tablet to Media Device mode and was able to copy photos, music and video to it with no issues. The popup keyboard worked fine; no issues. Typing emails and texts works great; it synced right up to my Gmail account no problem.Overall, I am very impressed. This is well worth the money. The display is nice, and very readable. The battery seems comparable to my wife's Nook Color. With a bit of tweaking, this could be a fantastic tablet for anyone. Well worth the money. In fact, I am amazed at the price. I highly recommend.MORE INFO - NEXT DAYSome additional info for those considering this tablet. The USB port is a micro USB, same as what you find on most Android smart phones and tablets. It uses the same cable and charger as my Motorola RAZR MAXX and my wife's DROID X2. Also, it appears to support OTG (on-the-go) USB. It will connect to a PC to transfer files (photos, documents, videos, etc.) and will also connect to a USB flash drive. Inside the box is a Type-A USB adapter cable. You connect your USB flash drive to it, then connect to the Zeepad and open the Android file manager (see photos). Also, I connected a USB keyboard this morning in the same way (via the Type-A adapter) and that worked, too. I was able to type/edit a letter, and type an email. No app was required for the keyboard, it was immediately recognized.I have tested Netflix, Skype, video playback, music playback, Angry Birds, Fruit Ninja, Temple Run, Pinball Deluxe, Hulu Plus, Lookout (anti-virus/malware app), Dolphin Web browser, Google Play, Gmail, and Kindle app (and store) and it all works great. No complaints. I've tested WiFi in three places, including home an office, and it was flawless and fast. The SD flash card slot is a MicroSD, not the standard SD card you find in most digital cameras. The MicroSD is very common on smart phones and tablets. The Zeepad 7 looks to support 16 GB cards with no issues.Android System App says the OS is 4.0.4 (Ice Cream Sandwich). Kernel build is 3.0.8+. Internal storage shows max 1008 MB for downloaded apps + 1636 MB for app data, and photos/videos/music transferred from your PC. Max RAM is 353 MB. Everything else is tied up by the OS. Adding an 8 GB or 16 GB MicroSD card would be best for storing music, photos and videos, and off-loading some apps and app data (that support off-loading to removable flash, not all do). The battery is reported as being a LiFe battery, which is lithium-iron-phosphate (LiFePO4). If true, that's impressive. LiFe is a high performance and capacity technology with a long cycle life (up to 2000 cycles, or 3-4 times that of lithium-ion). Such batteries are extremely safe; they will not explode or catch fire if over-charged or short-circuited. They can also be charged very rapidly, and can last 5+ years. So, if I can trust what the Android System App is telling me, I'm impressed. The display is 800 x 432, 60 Hz refresh, with a 160 dpi display density. It is very readable, and bright. I am running mine at 40% brightness. The CPU shows as being an ARM v7 running at 1008 MHz. The clock rate is variable; it will range between 60 and 1008 MHz automatically to reduce power drain - the OS does this automatically.Some things it does not have: obviously, no mobile networking support, only WiFi. So, you need to be in a WiFi hotspot to access the Internet (which is getting easier and easier in so many public places). There is no GPS. There is no rear-facing camera for taking photos, just the front facing camera for making video calls (that seems like an oversight to me, because a 5MP phone camera would be cheap to add). There is no Bluetooth, and no way to add it. None of these things are show-stoppers in my opinion for a $70 tablet, but would be nice if tablet designers could make some of this stuff available as modular user upgrades.Bottom line - this tablet is worth the price. Best $70 I've spent in a while.

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Tablet
Reviews.Author: Lishai
Reviews.Content: Purchased product for my kids and I love it. My husband and I have the Samsung Galaxy 10.1 so we were looking for something very similar but smaller for the kids. This is the closest by far to the high end tablets for a great price. I love how it runs off the play store, many we have looked at were Android but they ran off of the "get jar" market and didn't have much like the play store does. I recommend this product to everyone looking for and affordable tablet.

Reviews.Title: A Great Value. Glad I found it.
Reviews.Author: lj
Reviews.Content: ***UPDATED*** 11/18/13I promised I would update this review as time went on. This tablet has officially died. It will not turn on or charge no matter what I try.I still stand by my earlier statements that this is a good "value" purchase and/or entry tablet for young kids. Although you would expect things to last more than a year. I haven't looked into what the warranty is but I'm sure we're past it. It has served its purpose for us and I will be buying a better tablet later on to replace this one.If you know your expectations and you want a tablet that is cheap for young kids who may be rough on them, I recommend this tablet as long as you are not expecting more than a year and can deal with the issues I listed below.Otherwise, I would officially change my recommendation to a "Do not buy," or Buyer beware. If you are looking for a Nexus/Galaxy/iPad type experience, keep looking.***UPDATED*** See below original review***I just bought this for my son for Christmas and it came in the mail today. It has an expandable micro sd card slot (TF)and most people will probably need it. (Keep reading) I bought this one: SanDisk microSDHC 8GB Class 2 Card with SD Adapter (SDSDQ-8192). I've always found Sandisk to be pretty reliable. The onboard memory states 4 gb but the available memory was about 1gb so keep that in mind if it's important to you. Memory cards are dirt cheap and can easily get you where you want cheaper than going the "other" route.I took the pad out to play with it some. It comes installed with Angry Birds, Netflix, Facebook, Fruit Ninja, Play Store, Adobe flash player and of course your regular items (wallpaper, camera, clock widget, browser, wifi, etc.)Some have said the packaging had a knockoff look. A better choice of words would be that it has "generic" packaging. It's not a ripoff or knockoff which connotes images of backstreet deals from some guys trunk. That's not a fair assessment of this product. The instruction booklet is admittedly small but who needs an instruction booklet to run a tablet?My only concerns are that it withstands the test of time and the 10 year old. It seems well built. (One minor design flaw is the screen and the outer frame aren't flush with each other so there is a gap. It will definitely collect dirt and be hard to get out.) Not a deciding factor but I can see it getting on my OCD nerves. The camera is also average at best but I never understood why people needed a great camera for a tablet. (Is a tablet really going to be your go to camera for things like vacation?)We bought this for our 10 yr old son. As such I think it's important for people to understand what this tablet competes with. It would be a mistake to compare this to the iPad for both good and bad reasons.It isn't in competition with the iPad but rather the iPod touch. We went with this instead of the iTouch and saved a lot of $. It was $69 for a 4gb Android tablet (expandable to 32) vs. $199 for a 16gb iTouch (not expandable.)I think we made the right choice and I think he will like it. Good luck everyone. Be smart.I will update this review after Christmas when the tablet sees regular daily use.****UPDATE***It's always good to come back and reevaluate a product after the newness has worn off and you can think more objectively. My overall feeling on the tablet hasn't changed much. I would still recommend it to the target audience that I mentioned above. Again, if you are looking for a backup to your laptop or an alternative to an iPad, this probably isn't for you. But for those who have read the description and know what you're getting, this will still be a great product.Here are my impressions over the past week of regular use:Screen: I start with the screen because at first I was turned off by the screen. It is more of a durable plastic. However when I go to my Galaxy tablet and come back to it I am glad for the build and glad that my kids have the Zeepad. It's perfect for them.As such you should know though that it will probably show marks. I'm fine with that. After all it comes with a stylus. The screen protector that comes with it is lacking and we have been looking (unsuccessfully for some that will fit it). Screen protectors for a 7" tablet Do NOT fit the Zeepad. It is slightly smaller than 7" so keep that in mind. Also finding a case has been a bit challenging. Universal cases that hold the corners cause it rub against the power button (which may be a design flaw). Nevertheless none of these things would cause me to fret.While I am glad that the screen is durable, others may be turned off of it if they are used to the high glossy, colorful screens. The Zeepad will look dull in comparison but again who are you buying it for?One other issue that has given me pause is the wifi. It works great but it can be quirky at times. One time it was turned off and after selecting on it would immediately turn off again. It would continue to do this until we finally shut it down. After a little while it worked fine. Maybe this was a one time thing. It happens. Also the clock constantly reverts itself to January 1, 1970. I don't know the significance of that date (LOL) but I finally solved this by checking the setting to sync the clock with the network when connected to wifi. Again, maybe this is an isolated event.The battery: I would take off a 1/2 star for the screen build and another 1/2 star for the battery. It definitely doesn't seem to last long but kids do forget to charge things. If you travel a lot this could be an issue for you. You might get a converter to get around this. (Finding a car charger might be difficult. The AC power cord is of the small, round variety.)One last thing: the memory. I said in my original review that the memory issue (comes stock with around 1GB available) could be worked around with a memory card. That is still technically true but in reality it has proven a little more difficult to run apps solely from the memory card. This could be an Android limitation as I am still new to the Android ecosystem. There is an app called App to SD which has made it a little more simpler but I am still not sure that it frees much space on the tablet. There are simply some games that you won't be able to play on this tablet. (So far it seems to be the racing games: Need for Speed, Asphalt, etc.) These use a lot of memory.While it may seem that I have changed my mind on this tablet because of these comments, in reality I haven't. I still consider it a good purchase and the proof of that is the recipient still enjoys it and loves it. However I wanted to be thorough for those who were still thinking of purchasing. All things considered I would still rate this a solid 4 star product and worth the risk if you understand who the target audience is and should be and also temper your expectations in regards to other similar products.PS - Just FYI. A lot of people are leaving negative reviews on this product because of shipping issues. Please read the reviews and find out if this product is for you. I am sad that others had shipping problems. Ours arrived in good time, from West coast to East coast during Christmas rush. Research the seller. There are probably some drop shippers used by Amazon that have nothing to do with the company that makes them. I have seen 2 or 3 different sellers to these.Hope this helps.**BATTERY UPDATE**Some users have experienced issues with the battery. I have monitored this with my son and we have come to the conclusion that the battery life is approximately 2-3 hours. It seems to be about 2.5 hours on average. This is basically Minecraft (which is all he plays) and nothing else. We have monitored it with low power usage apps and received about the same results. In short, you would be fortunate to get over 3 assuming all tablets are the same and this is the norm for these batteries.There was also an issue with the charger. It sometimes prefers certain outlets. Some outlets won't charge it correctly. I am assuming this is an adapter issue since we live in the USA. The adapter seems generic and I am currently trying to find a backup just in case.This still doesn't change much from my initial review but I wanted to keep the review updated. I always appreciated it when people would continue to be open minded toward their products and let others know how it was going.The battery issue may be disappointing to some but as I said above, it really all depends on who you're buying it for. My son has learned to work around it by keeping it charged and in all honesty kids need limits anyway. Long car trips could pose a problem but a converter would do the trick.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - This is a worse than bad SCAM
Reviews.Author: Always Already "Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: How can something be worse than bad you might ask. I ordered this product on Jan 24, 2013 from Amazon. I was told it would be shipped from China and I could expect a longer delivery time.  It finally arrived on Feb 26. The tablet did turn on but could NOT be charged.  I was told by Amazon that I would have to contact the seller.  The seller responded that I would have to ship the item back to China at my expense which I did ship it back and kept my proof of mailing and it cost another $30.96.  I shipped it back on March 1, 2013.  It is now May 1, 2013 and the seller via email keeps telling me they will refund my money (less $30.96) "as soon as they receive the item".  Well, guess what? After 60 days I do not believe they will ever receive the item.So this is how it can be worse than bad.  Amazon will do nothing and the seller will do nothing and I have lost my original purchase price plus another $30.96 so that I might be able to participate in this scheme.  The seller is better off sending crappy product that gets returned.  He is out nothing. WHAT A SCAM AMAZON HAS ALLOWED BY PROCESSING MY PAYMENT AND OFFERING THIS PRODUCT - AMAZON SHOULD BE ASHAMED.

Reviews.Title: Superb Value!!!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: At first I had my doubts about purchasing this product. But I'm certainly glad I took the risk. Considering I wanted this device mostly as an e-reader, the tablet would be worth the price even if all it i did was respond to touch and read PDF's. But it does a lot more. The right thing to do is to not have high expectations. I mean, after all, it's incredibly inexpensive. But I am honestly surprised as to how functional this tablet is.I'll start by listing the cons to get them out the way:-Ports and jacks quality: poor(Some of the physical ports, like the AC and micro USB may not align perfectly. You may need to push hard.)-UI virtual movement response: seldom slight lag.(The UI response lag is slightly noticeable at times, but not significant. Most of the time it responds very well, you have to be very picky to care for a few hundred milliseconds)-Bluetooth: None-Technical Support: Poor/Non-existentNow for the Pros:-Android 4.0 : Excellent OS & UI-Rooted!: Root access enabled(You'll be able to install apps that require root access)-Graphic processing: Impressive(I was able to play Raging Thunder 2, Angry birds Starwars, and some other demanding games without any lag)-G-Sensor: Yes-Display and touch response: Good(The display is much better than others have described it. The touch response is on point)-Micro USB OTG: Allows you to plugin many common USB devices (have tried Flash drives, Mice, Keyboards)-Included Bonus: Ear buds, Micro USB to OTG cable, Screen protector(perfect fit), USB to PC cable, Tablet Pen.Other observations & comments:-The device comes with a proprietary charger, which I thought was kinda lame, until I discovered you can also charge the device using any Micro-USB charger (Recommended use: 5v - 2A).-No micro HDMI (Oh well)-Google Voice recognition works great at a fair distance.-Running: ES File Explorer with LAN file management - Good, Android VNC client - Good, Fling - Good, Google Play - No limitations, SuperUser - Good, ConnectBot - Good, AutoKiller - Good, Terminal Emulator - Good, Tasker - Limited.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME affordable tablet
Reviews.Author: A friendly helper
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best buys i have gotten. I mean I got this for 70 bucks including shipping and it works like a dream. No lag well maybe sometimes while searching stuff but other then i have not found anything wrong with this tablet. Shadowgun runs surprisingly well and Dead trigger runs really good. One more thing if found that was wrong with it was Temple run because i could not move the guy by turning the tablet. And the package arrived exactly on time. Couldn't of asked more for a tablet of this cost.

Reviews.Title: Great item for the price
Reviews.Author: MetroidX
Reviews.Content: So I was kinda skeptical at first, how good of a tablet can you really get for $80? I was pleasantly surprised though. This little tablet is very responsive, the build quality is pretty good, and it even has expandable memory (which my more expensive tablet does not). I bought this as a xmas gift for my girlfriend and overall I'm really happy with it. My only real gripe with it is the screen, but for the price I can't complain. There's no dead pixels or anything, you can kinda just tell the screen is cheap based on viewing angles and quality of images. It's really not that bad though and again, for $80 what do you expect. I especially like the size of this device. It's nice and compact and fits easily in my sweatshirt pocket but yet it's still big enough to where you can set it down and watch something on it. I definitely think it's worth it and it should be able to do everything my girlfriend should need to do on a tablet - surfing the web, Youtube, watching movies, listening to music, reading books, etc. I'd definitely recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Not the best, but very good for the price
Reviews.Author: Ignotus
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a very basic day to day machine. It is not fancy, not top of the line. It has a low quality feel to it, however, do not be fooled. This is a very good tablet to do your daily things, without having the fear to break your $200-$500 tablet.Let me mention some of the pros and cons of this machine, and this is my personal observation.Pros:For the price, it is pretty rugged and well made, you won't break it easily (but do not test it :-))It has Google Play apps, which is important.It is not large, can fit into a large pocket, or holder.Battery life is considerably long and that makes it great for travel.Easy to touch by finger and price is very affordable.Cons:The volume does not go to levels that you could hear some stations, prepare to use headphones in some cases.No GPS is installed in this machine, map directions cannot be used on road.App pages are limited, but it still isn't bad.Camera quality is very basic. Do not expect to have high quality pics.Overall, I am very happy with this tablet so far. It is an affordable machine, and you get what you pay for. I also have a Samsung S2 which is much higher in quality on all levels. But hey, this is a machine that if you break, it won't break your heart with it. It is pretty rugged, as I said.

Reviews.Title: Decent little electronic for 10 year old.
Reviews.Author: Kari Hunsaker
Reviews.Content: This tablet is fun now, but for the first week it was frustrating to figure out. One helpful thing is if you have knowledge of Android products in the first place. I'm an Apple user so once my cousin, an Android user, played with it, he figured it all out.My 10 year old daughter loves this electronic. She is able to Skype with family, watch You Tube, listen to music, and play games. Not a bad price for a little gadget!

Reviews.Title: this is one hell of a little tablet  crappy seller
Reviews.Author: daniel
Reviews.Content: this is one hell of a little tablet for the pricedoes almost everything my 500.00 tablet does if it had gps id be buying one for my selfthat said ill prob be buying one or two morescreen is very responsive tablet is very fast and plays anything on the market even the high end games like death trigger played smoothlynetflix streams smooth and youtube alsoamzing for the price if your looking for a first tablet for yourself or a child this would be the one to getAfter having it a week the power button broke and fell inside waiting for seller to respond to emailswell the seller never responded to any email so I would not buy from them again was a great tablet till it broke and they don't care

Reviews.Title: srf2004
Reviews.Author: Srf2004
Reviews.Content: Great price tablet works really good screen touch is good.freat for starter tablet recommend for anyone. It was a gift and my daughter loves it

Reviews.Title: My 11 year old daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: Michael Cohen "twcable"
Reviews.Content: Admittedly I'd never use this. Not up to my geek standards and feels cheap, but the bottom line on this is that my 11 year old daughter has no standards and uses it for Netflix, Skype, Angry Birds and to surf the internet. She had been living with an iPod Touch 4th gen which got ruined when the charging pins moved, and yet she's still happy with this. This is probably due to the larger, mostly responsive screen size. I downgraded the stars because the micro usb port was DOA. I wouldn't even have noticed except my son bought a keyboard case for her which plugs into the port. On the upside, Amazon gave a full refund (I've had mixed experience on this, but this was clearly a manufacturing issue). In order to prevent the volley back and forth with Amazon if the next one had problems, I bought it again locally.For a child, this is the only tablet to buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Lilian C
Reviews.Content: We ordered two of these for the kids. They both work fine. Download of Apps is easy and the apps it comes with are very cool and all work.Reviews mentioned batery issues, some things we noticed and settings we changed that helped extend the battery run time considerably are as follows: When you first get the Zeepad the instructions say to charge them for six hours before the first use. Make sure and do that but when you connect the charger the plug that goes into the tablet will not go all the way in until the plug dissapears into the charger input so don't try to force it all the way in. When it "clicks" it's in as far as it can go. There will be a little of the silver part of the plug still visible that does not go into the tablet charger port. If you force it you might damage the unit.  After the first charge the instructions say charge for only 4hours. Do not overcharge and it would be good to set a timer so that you don't over charge the battery. The battery it comes with can be charged and discharged over 2 thousand times but it does not like to be over charged. Also don't not store the unit with a 100% charge for long periods of time, these new batteries like to be stored with 50-40% power only. If they are left to sit for a long time with 100% charge it can damage the structure of the batteries.  Rune time: The main killer of the battery run time is,  the screen brightness. Lower it as the screen is super bright and at only 7 inches they cannot build it with a very large battery. Leaving the screen on the super bright setting eats the batteries pretty quickly. The next big juice hog is the wifi. If yu are not going to be downloading apps, surfing or sending e-mails turn on airplane mode which turns off wiifi. Leaving the wifi on all the time keeps the table searching for the wifi signal and commnicating back and forth with the source and that eats the battery. Once you set it up and are using game apps ( what most kids do ) you dont need the wifi for them while they play apps anyway. If you do these two things the battery should last a bit over 2-2-1/2 hours on a 4 hour charge. Not bad. I wont get into the tech aspects as others have covered that pretty well in other reviews but considering these cost a lot less than other brands the main thing I was concerned with was, if it actually did what they were supposed to do. They both have worked fine and side by side to a samsung galaxy they donwloaded apps at just about the same speed as any other andriod tablet or i phone. The build quality is pretty good considrng the price. If you are looking for some "special ops" military grade hardware this is not the unit for you but if you need something to use daily under normal conditions these are pretty nice. The tablets are impressive and are worth the money. They come from overseas so shipping is not super fast. If you need them for a birthday order with plenty of time to give them a chance to ship from the factory.  If something goes wrong I will update this review but so far, these little tablets has been a very good purchase and the kids love them. Hope this info helps, The battery is not an issue but I addressed that more as most of the negative reviews had to do with them and that was the main thing I worried about when I ordered them. Happy to say the batteries have not been an issue so far. Very nice, congratulations to the company that makes them it looks like you have a nice product here that delivers a good product at a very good price !

Reviews.Title: smile turned upside down
Reviews.Author: simply me
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 of these for my kids. Despite most of the negative comments about it not lasting long and the chargers not working properly and it freezes. My kids love it. Until..... they all stopped working one by one. The chargers never worked so we used some universal chargers we already had. Turns out that all those negative comments were true. 3 happy faces ended up sad. A waste of money. We purchased in mid Jan. 2013 and here it is march and they don't work. TICKED OFF!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Keaundre Peak
Reviews.Content: It was better than i excpected it to be for the price. It runs smoothly and is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: FIND ANOTHER TABLET
Reviews.Author: skypilot39b
Reviews.Content: EDIT I dropped the review on this to one star from three.  I purchased two of these tablets for my kids (12 & 9) one died fairly quickly, the story of how the company was willing to deal with that is below.  When I ran anti-virus software on the second one (AVG) I found that the device came to me rooted which tells me the version of Android firmware that is on it is highly suspect and likely counterfeit--that would explain why the tablets don't update with Android updates when my other Android products do.FIND ANOTHER TABLET!The tablet itself seems to work well, what was a problem was when we received it the only charger that came for the tablet was designed for Eastern European plugs, there was an adapter but by the time you got them plugged together the stack was nearly 3 inches from the wall and weighed so much that it wouldn't stay plugged in.  There was also a micro USB cable included and we used that to charge the systems for a while but that quit working.  I contacted the company and they were willing to exchange the tablet after shipping it to China.  They also said they'd fix the problem with the charger and sent me another identical adapter.I believe this company is trying to do their best but they don't have an understanding of the US Market, I'd purchase from a different supplier.I also thought the tablet had two cameras, it only has a front facing one.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves it!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Welles
Reviews.Content: Awesome product for the price! She was able to download all her favorite apps without any issues. All in all, it is an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: I HAVE MY CELL PHONE BACK!!!  YAAY...
Reviews.Author: Sherry Harkless
Reviews.Content: My son is 5... he LOVES to play video games on my cell phone.  Well... he did not need an expensive ipad at 5 years old so I got him the Zeepad and downloaded all his favorite games.  Set the restrictions to downloaded content at its highest level and whalla!!!  He is in hog heaven!  AND  I've got my cell phone back!  Loooove it!!!  ;-)

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Felix Sanchez
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for our son. He loves it. He uses it all the time.He even takes it to school and because it was so affordable we don't worry about him losing it. Nice screen.

Reviews.Title: Thanks Amazon
Reviews.Author: Sharon Edquist
Reviews.Content: Initially this was an amazing product. However, after having this for a month. The charger outlet, no longer would hold a charge. Very disappointed. This was wasted money. Now it sits and hasnt been used since the first month! :(

Reviews.Title: Zeepad
Reviews.Author: Omen-13
Reviews.Content: Bought for my 10 year old grandson. He loves it. Works great so far. Had no problems except getting the screen cover to go on smoothley.

Reviews.Title: Zeepad 7.0 Allwinner A13 Boxchip Cortex A8 Android 4.0. 4GB Capacity
Reviews.Author: Margo
Reviews.Content: Starting in the 80's with a Vc 20 and Commodore 64, then onto desktops always graduating 2 bigger and better! A laptop 3 yrs ago and now this tablet, can u tell I'm a babyboomer :) From a 3 yr old neighbor's great grandchild to many senior citizen's here were surprised @ the price and especially the ease learning the "ZEE"! Even people who have lost fine motor skills are "quite taken" with all the apps and look forward 2 more being developed. The only con? The puny user guide with the most smallest font ever...the awesome customer service suggested 2 google any Android 4.0 generic guide and 2 access youtube 4 more detailed assistance! Following her advice both suggestions are much more informative than that so-called guide enclosed in packaging. On limited budgets this tablet, new users of all ages would do well in considering the Zeepad.

Reviews.Title: Great for kids!
Reviews.Author: E. Morissette "Amazon Queen"
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet for a novice user or a child.  Nothing fancy about the applications, but awesome for general Internet, YouTube or simple game use.  The volume (even at the max) is really low, but nothing a set of headphones won't cure. :)

Reviews.Title: freezes constantly
Reviews.Author: arleen
Reviews.Content: I got this for my grandaughter from the first day it kept freezing over and over again she has a laptop and a computer so Ipretty sure its not because she doesn't know how to use it. It was a christmas present so I felt very bad that it wasn't workingright for her.

Reviews.Title: Good price
Reviews.Author: trudy carey
Reviews.Content: Nice tablet for the money and has a lot of bells and whistles that my grandson wanted. I am not super tech savvy so a adult might want something more expensive but for anyone that doesn't want to invest in a high dollar one or need one for kids..I would suggest this one

Reviews.Title: First Tablet, Not so bad.
Reviews.Author: K.Dunson "K.Dunson"
Reviews.Content: I looked through many websites to find a decent tablet for my son, who's 9yrs. old.  Even at his age, he knows what a decent tablet should do and how it should work.  I bought it for him for Christmas.  I must say, he is one happy camper! Basically what he wanted it to do, it does. We haven't had any problems with it yet and my son uses it very often.  So, with that said, I gave it 5 stars because it was delivered quickly and my son loves it!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Tiara Phillips
Reviews.Content: My son got this for Christmas and absolutely loves it.  The WIFI works great and he is able to play all the games he wants.  Think I am going to buy my daughter one for Valentines day!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: carrie1976
Reviews.Content: Got these for my first grade girls for Xmas.  They arrived fast and the color and product is perfect for what I wanted.  Price was great.  Even includes a screen protector.  Can't wait for Christmas morning.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the Price
Reviews.Author: Gemini Passion
Reviews.Content: This is a great product for those just wanting a tablet experience.  It offers all the basic options as most higher end tablets.  The camera could be a little better, but all in all it is nice.

Reviews.Title: Terrible, Terrible hardware - don't believe 5-star reviews, those are astroturf
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "porkrind-jm"
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hardware I have ever had the displeasure to buy. I bought it from nomorerack.com because it was a "deal" at $59. Unfortunately, the browser is so unbelievably slow that it's only usable if you don't mind waiting 3 minutes for each click (not an exaggeration). I don't believe that anyone can run netflix or any other video service on this, as the processing power is simply too small - thus my conclusion that anyone giving this 5 stars must be astroturfing.Also, it frequently crashes and needs to be rebooted. Absolutely unusable. My wife's phone is faster and has a better screen, so the tablet offers nothing for her. I have to buy another tablet now, so that's $59 I lost in an experiment.

Reviews.Title: Dead after two months!!
Reviews.Author: tksme122306
Reviews.Content: Worked good for a few weeks. Became slower and slower over the following couple months until it finally stopped charging. This tablet has two different charging ports and neither worked after two months. I put the tablet in my desk and left it there the past 9 months. Decided to give it another try. It won't charge. I decided to leave a review. I never did get another tablet after having a bad experience with this one. I lost my money with this purchase. Just wish I could have got a replacement. I would spend the money on the more expensive ones.**UPDATE: I decided to contact the manufacturer because it was still under warranty. They told me they would fix the tablet but I had to pay to ship it to them and pay to have it returned back to me. So I basically would be paying more for the tablet then I already have. I get a defective tablet and they don't want to fix their mistake at their expense. I just told them nevermind. :/

Reviews.Title: Charger is bad in all of them
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: So I bought this product a long time ago but I was shopping for Christmas presents  and ran into the zeepad I wanted to give you buyers a warning I bought this for my daughter for her birthday. I will say they run and work great WHILE THEY LAST. They can not take any wear and tear at all. So lets start with zeepad number 1 I ordered it got it in good time wanted to get it charged and set up before she opened it so she could play right away. I open it put it on to charge and it wont charge unless I prop  it  on something to put pressure on it. I should have sent back right away but I ordered it late and party was next day figured I could give to her and see if it was just outlet. After one week it would not charge at all. So I send back get a new one. I get it charges fine so i think ok other one just bad but after 2 weeks it will not charge you have to fiddle with charger to get it to light then another few days will not charge at all So I send back again to get the THIRD ZEEPAD. The third time the charger just fell inside after 3 weeks use. So after the last time I said screw this  go on another site find a kindle fire for 70 dollars got it and have had it 6 months now. Do not buy this product it may work great the first month but after that it WILL break and if u pass the warranty you are out of luck. There are times you can find good deals where you pay cheap price but get a great product. This is not one of those products you get what you pay for on this one. You are better off spending a bit more and getting something that will last. This not worth it. Yes I know I was only spending like 60-70 dollars on a tablet so I cant expect the world. I didn't want to spend 300-400 on a top of the line product for a 7 year old to play on so I just went with this and like I said I cant expect a product that will last years but 3 of these in like 2-3 month is bad she only got about a month all together of play time because a lot of this was shipping back then you wait for them to get bad product before they ship new one. So she got a little over a month on all 3 and after the second one I made sure I was the only one charging it just to be sure it was not her being ruff on it. I was only one charging it was so careful and still charger problem. Just wanted to give everyone a warning because I was so disappointed she was so excited to get one and I was happy to get her one and I was let down. Don't want this to happen to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: spend more & get a better tablet
Reviews.Author: ddk
Reviews.Content: Within a day or two this tablet started to move so slow and getting it to recognize touch commands was extremely frustrating.  Rendering it useless...

Reviews.Title: 7" Zeepad 7.0 Allwinnwer A13 Boxchip Cortex A8 Android 4.0, 4GB Capacity
Reviews.Author: pescador2004
Reviews.Content: 7" Zeepad 7.0 Allwinnwer A13 Boxchip Cortex A8 Android 4.0, 4GB Capacity,... it was dead two weeks after purchase very bad quality

Reviews.Title: Piece of CRAP!!!
Reviews.Author: Kelli Schindel
Reviews.Content: Bought this item for myself to assist with my photography business and keep things straight.  It worked for an hour then quit as soon as I added apps.  I'm glad I only paid $60 for it vs. the $199 that was listed as the regular price.  Will not purchase from this manufacturer again!

Reviews.Title: Great for
Reviews.Author: Cindy H.
Reviews.Content: Great for beginners ! my 4 years son loves it, It's easy to use and require charging every 2 hours

Reviews.Title: zeepad
Reviews.Author: mah55
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this.  She can carry where ever she goes.  It is fully functional as a computer, can be used for games, music and holds a charge well.  My daughter has down syndrome and she has no trouble figuring it out.

Reviews.Title: Can't watch Google Play Movies, but otherwise my kid is happy playing her game apps.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am frustrated that I can download Google Play, but the movie that grandma and grandpa bought for her just won't play on the zeepad.  We have Google Play engineers trying to solve the problem. I was disappointed to realize there is no customer service number on the manual from Zeepad, nor can I find a customer service number on the internet.My daughter loves playing her Disney games and taking photos and video.  She's happy. I'm not fully.

Reviews.Title: Pissed I wasn't money
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Toya
Reviews.Content: No it did not meet my expectations!! This was a complete waste of money! I could be right by my wifi & it would tell me there's "no connection"... A lot of things are slow. I wouldn't even bother. I would be Bette off getting an iPad, galaxy tablet, hell the kindle fire would have been better!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!!!
Reviews.Author: Mommy0608
Reviews.Content: This product might seem like a bargain for the price but the tablet is no good. It had glitches from the moment we turned it on. We'll be pressing one thing and the tablet will decide to do something completely different or nothing at all. I bought 2 tablets but ordered them at different times so I figured I would see if the second tablet had the same issue which it did. I am returning the products

Reviews.Title: not a bad deal,  but description lies.
Reviews.Author: magda
Reviews.Content: the shipping was fast,  the device works,  but the specs are dishonest.  it says 4GB capacity,  but it only came with one,  and one for the sd card.  i had to put an 8GB sd card before i gave it to my friend as a gift.  i couldn't just guve it to her with such grossly unmet specs.  i dont know if dealers know this,  but it is illegal to sell some something that does not match it's advertised description.  you can't someone you're gonna sell them a chicken,  and give them a dog.  who do approach about compensation??

Reviews.Title: Very easy to operate!
Reviews.Author: jamie hang
Reviews.Content: Resolution is not as good compare to the higher end tablets but still a good quality overall. So far no lag and runs better than expected. Perfect for the younger ones.

Reviews.Title: temp tablet won't last long
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Robbins
Reviews.Content: Worked great for 6 months then power button came off power board and there is no way to repair it.  Spend a little more or buy one with a repair/replacement plan.

Reviews.Title: Help
Reviews.Author: Norma Ruckey
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of the ZEEPad's  On this one (pink) the camera picture is blurry.  the other (green) the picture is OK.  I already have several apps downloaded and e mail set up and have since thrown away the return slip.  I am leaving Thursday for a week.  So I am hesitant to return.  Is there anything else I cando.  Everything else seems OK with the exception of the fuzziness of the camera.  Maybe there is a focus button I cannot locate.

Reviews.Title: good if you plan on buying protection plan at time you buy tablet otherwise not good item
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: i have bought two of these for my 11 and 10 yr old boys who only use them indoors sitting down no rough housing or anything like that and they seemed to be really good at first. the first one bought was working fine then only two months later it stopping working correctly. a month after i bought the first i bought a second one and when it arrived it already had problems with some things now only over one month of having it the touch screen stopped working also. so with in few mo s both are not able to be used due to touch screen not working anymore. if u buy this also buy protection plan. because if not you will be stuck with useless electronics also.

Reviews.Title: Bad choice
Reviews.Author: carolyn chandler
Reviews.Content: This was a piece of junk and the seller never responded to my request for help.it worked for two weeks and then the tabs started to fall off form the inside and it was humpy dumpy from that point on. I'm not poverty stricken,but I don'tHave that kind of money to just give away.No matter how old the child is don't disappoint them with this product.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Sharon Perry
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandaughter. It was slow from the start & I should have returned it then but made the mistake of letting her keep it, now three months later it doesn't work at all, it is junk! I should have got her a Kindle or a Nook, I guess you get what you pay for! I received no help from the seller or the manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Thought it would last longer than 2 months!!
Reviews.Author: cdhj1234
Reviews.Content: Had this tablet for 2 months. It has frozen several times and now will not hold a charge. The charger broke within the first month. The tablet will not charge at all now. I can't return it because it is out of the time window to return. No idea how to contact seller!! Very frustrating!!

Reviews.Title: Slows and freeze up often
Reviews.Author: Donaisha Walker
Reviews.Content: Terribly slow!!!!! Don't buy! I buy it for my child who loves tablets even she can't deal with the  terrible drag....

Reviews.Title: excellent buy
Reviews.Author: Ana Jacquelinne Bueno Perez "Miami"
Reviews.Content: my daughter loved it.!! she can surf the net, go to her facebook and play some games. Has loads of applications to download, plus you can use nexflix and you tube. I recommend it, for me it was an excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for my 7 year old & he LOVES it!
Reviews.Author: A Nu Redd
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to spend as money on a tablet for my son as I did for my Ipad because I was scared he wouldn't take care of it and it would be down the drain. I ran across this one on Amazon and figured for the price, I wouldn't be upset should he damage or break it. To my surprise, he has had this for over 6 months, there are no scratches, he has all of the games he wanted, and he has accidentally dropped a few times & there has been NO damage to report at all! It  takes a licking and keeps on ticking! Perfect for younger children. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: useless..
Reviews.Author: Esmeralda
Reviews.Content: It's useless , this is the second one i bought and once again it doesnt want to charge and i've bought like 3 chargers for it already . waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Not many apps but it is decent
Reviews.Author: G. Lynch
Reviews.Content: this is for my son and at its price I feel like it does what it can.  So its a decent buy.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: SheriK
Reviews.Content: This is a good tablet for the price, the screen protector was a little tricky to get the bubbles out,but I bought it for a 4 & 5 year old so I  didn't want nothing to fancy. I would buy it again!

Reviews.Title: Would not purchase again
Reviews.Author: autumn
Reviews.Content: My daughter worked this summer to save money to purchase a tablet. We found this one and thought we would give it a try. The charger didn't work, when we contacted the seller they told us to use a cell phone charger ( not what I paid for) also it freezes a lot. Would not purchase another one.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Vulpie
Reviews.Content: I don't have a laptop and being a design, a tablet would be a great tool so I bought the Zeepad because it's cheap and the reviews were great! I was pleasantly surprised by all of the stuff it came with (usb adapter to upload my portfolio, screen protector, stylus, etc) and by how responsive it is! It's just as quick as my Dad's $200 tablet but for more than half the price! It's small, but I don't need anything too big anyway, and the camera is nice to skype with my friends (note: if you're going to use skype, uninstall the skype app that comes with it and install the current version from the play store, otherwise video doesn't work). The only real complaint I have about it is the battery life but that's fine by me considering it's price. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: WoPad 8
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: It tends to run a little hot. Can be tough to hold. Freezes sometimes and seems to kick the Wifi modem off a lot on certain downloads. Color is nice. Screen is ok. Camera's are weak. But for the money and Pacman type apps and the fact it does browse the internet and do most basic functions I guess its Ok. Battery time could be a little longer. 1st run it stayed up about 6 hours. After that the battery time seems to be on average of about 2 hours. Chord is to short to run on charger. If you do run on charger it gets really hot. If it lasts a year I'll consider it worth the money paid.

Reviews.Title: zpad
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Perfect size. Battery life could be a little longer. Needs car charger. Operating system a little slow. Otherwise awesome product.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Jak8787
Reviews.Content: Everything internal was shifted, none of the ports lined up with the plugs, same with the power button, it was partially depressed on one side.

Reviews.Title: returned it
Reviews.Author: DP
Reviews.Content: Tablet is really slow, major delay in typing as well, after two weeks the charging port broke so I returned it which was very easy to do through Amazon, they sent ups the next day to pick it up

Reviews.Title: For my daughter
Reviews.Author: Pat Sadler
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves it.  She left it in a friend's car and he used it and loved it.  So, this seems to be a winner.  I have a Kindle and for the price difference, this can't be beat.  She says the camera is also very good.

Reviews.Title: USELESS
Reviews.Author: tedward
Reviews.Content: The screen parted from body as I tried to get protective package cover off. Cracked the screen and unit went dead!!

Reviews.Title: Zeepad 7.0
Reviews.Author: C. Kulik
Reviews.Content: For the price, I find the Zeepad very good.  The only thing I don't get is how to take a picture when there is no viewing hole in the back.  The only picture you can take is of yourself!  I would like it if the battery lasted more than an hour, but all in all, I think it is a good buy for what I use it for.  I have downloaded games (It comes with Angry Birds) and books.  I like it.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Lmmbee
Reviews.Content: When the tablet arrived it was extremely slow and was not compatible with many of the apps I wanted. I was told to restore it, that didn't work and then I was told to go to a website to go and do another update. After all of that it still didn't run anything.

Reviews.Title: poor battery
Reviews.Author: Tish McCracken
Reviews.Content: very poor battery life!! would not connect to wifi!,often locked while in use. cute and lite weight,loaded apps easily. returned it.

Reviews.Title: Little tablet
Reviews.Author: E. Carrasquillo "lizriver"
Reviews.Content: The plastic is a bit cheap, even for the price. Still my kids like it.  Was very disappointed you can't charge overnight.

Reviews.Title: Flemsy
Reviews.Author: Vegasguy
Reviews.Content: Don't let this thing get handled incorrectly or for that matter broken, because it wont be able to get fixed stateside and the wait roundtrip is way to long.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy!
Reviews.Author: TONYA STANTON
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet as a late Christmas gift for my son. The reviews were pretty good, and I have never had to return anything I purchased from Amazon.com. My son received this tablet at the end of January. On the outside of the box was written Tablet PC, MID Android, nothing about a Zeepad 7.0 Allwinner like the online description stated. The invoice was from a totally different vendor (from China DanDan Wu, pandawill.com) than who I ordered it from HD-Design. After about three months the device stopped charging and is no longer working. I expected my son to have this device longer than three months. Do not buy this item!

Reviews.Title: Broken :(
Reviews.Author: Jasmine Nordstrom
Reviews.Content: My daughter was super excited to receive this and she had it not even a month it was in a case it dropped the screen still broke.  I have had multiple electronics and they have dropped never broke.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Sharon R
Reviews.Content: I received this on time.  I really like it but it's a little slow when using wi-fi/internet.  I love the color and the size.  It fits it my purse. It works great with the keyboard/case that I bought along with it.

Reviews.Title: zeepad
Reviews.Author: john k
Reviews.Content: First of all the tablet was not brand new because there was a picture of the previous owner on it. Second the tablet was nothing like we expected.

Reviews.Title: Not made good!!
Reviews.Author: vicki miller
Reviews.Content: I got this for my 15 year old daughter for Christmas, and she was taking very good care of it, but within one day of use her buttons for the power and the volume broke and fell out of the tablet. We could not turn it on anymore or use it at all. I have sent it back for them to fix or return my money. Made SO CHEAP!!

Reviews.Title: It took forever to get here
Reviews.Author: Aud
Reviews.Content: I placed the order on December 9th, I received it on December 21st. Coming from California going to Washington State, With that said, the product itself is exactly as described. It is a bit slow, especially if you put a live wallpaper on. The picture itself doesn't have the greatest resolution, but for the price it's good. I did notice that the picture fits better when the tablet is upside down. The only downfall to that is if you're using the camera. Overall, I would say it's great for a kid or someone who doesn't need much on a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great little android pad
Reviews.Author: G-Man
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I fired this thing up.  It comes preloaded with fruit ninja and angry birds.  So after wasting far too much time on that, then I started loading apps from the Play Store... No problems what so ever.  I liked it so much I bought a second one for my wife.

Reviews.Title: Waist of money
Reviews.Author: V. Davis
Reviews.Content: My daughter got this for a Christmas present.  It worked ok for a month (touch screen not a responsive a the kindle fire) but the battery life starting decreasing to about 45 min, the shell kept coming undone on one side, and then the on/off switch broke.  The unit only comes with a generic users manual.  No company info, no phone numbers to call, etc.  Less than a month after Christmas all that is left is a very upset little girl.

Reviews.Title: This product sucks!!
Reviews.Author: Pattie Cummings
Reviews.Content: I have contacted seller for hopes of replacing item that I have purchased but no reply.  I am currently looking for a computer repair store to fix the problem I am having since it appears that I am stuck with the broken tablet. Will not be spending my hard earned money with this guy again!!

Reviews.Title: Didnt get it
Reviews.Author: Mad Dude
Reviews.Content: I didn't get it. Was suppose to be a present for my younger sister for Christmas didn't get here on time and still waiting.

Reviews.Title: I know a little girl who is going to be disappointed next week
Reviews.Author: May
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the product when I received it a few days ago, thought it would be perfect for our first foray into tablets for my younger daughter.  I charged it, found a wi-fi connection to download a few age-appropriate apps, and then tested it today after using it only a handfull of times only to find that the on/off button was flush with the top of the tablet, and unresponsive.  it had been a somewhat "loose" button to begin with but after a little prodding, the button actually recessed into the tablet and remained unresponsive.  The tablet turns on when the charger is plugged in and is fully functional, but that's not going to help us much.  I'm not sure what it will take to return it, but will try a replacement and I will update the review if the next one is more functional.

Reviews.Title: Looks can be deceiving..,
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: They say don't judge a book by its cover. This Zeepad presentation looked great but my first hour just navigating thru it it started to freeze up on me and lost its charge.It took forever to charge back up and one week later it completely died and will not cut back on smh. U get what you pay for. Cheap can become expensive. This was indeed a waste

Reviews.Title: Slowest tablet possible, virtually useless.
Reviews.Author: E. Gormly
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet ONLY to play music, the plan was to post it on the wall in our office where we do a lot of work as our phone just was not cutting it.  The packaging screams cheap but that's to be expected with an 80.00 tablet.  what was not expected was the inability to play music, it does play... 60 seconds after you click a button in Google Music and once it's started you cannot stop it for another 60 seconds, the point is this is ridiculously slow, even after removing everything installed on it. Displaying album art is non existent as well as even the song names.  if you click out to look at another album, you better go brew a coffee and take a shower, it might be ready when you get back.  This was not a symptom of Google's app either as all the other music players I tried had the same issues.On top of that turning it on and off is a problem, after it goes into sleep you have to hold the button for 30-60 seconds for it to reboot, it will not turn back on after it shuts down the screen like all other tablets do.  I read some of the reviews and unless I got a bum tablet I cannot see how anyone can get this to work properly, there is no way anyone can function by clicking a button and waiting 30 seconds for something to happen.Try it, think "click" in your head and then count to 30. that's how long it takes to respond when an app is open.I cannot say how it plays games but if a simple MP3 is any indication this is not worth 8 dollars let alone 80.I would not give this item to my worst enemy... or wait, maybe I would...We should have sent Osama a few of these in 2001, we'd have found him in the same cave still trying to power it on.Update 01/20/2013: after looking at this thing siting in the box waiting for the return I decided to try one thing, I forgot that I did not erase my google credentials so I opened it and did a "reset".Oddly enough, now the thing is snappy enough to play the music and show albums and turn on and off properly, not sure what did it and it doesn't change my rating but it now works for my purpose  So if you get a sluggish unit, try resetting it in the settings of the device.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Rory Cockerline
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be a good tablet to buy for my daughter. I was wrong the tablet fell apart the first time she dropped it. The seller says it is great for kids, but I will agree to disagree on that statement. Besides the tablet not being durable what so ever it is very slow and I am constantly having to go into settings and fix things for her. About a month ago I gave her my old nook and she has not had a single problem that she has had with the Zeepad. My advice spend a few extra bucks on a better tablet or go buy one of the thousands of quality used ones you can find online.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: darknessfall201 "darknessfall201"
Reviews.Content: I actually like this one better than the white one I have.I feel like this one is faster and does not lag as much with multiple tasks.Overall,definitely recommend getting it if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Better than what it cost
Reviews.Author: John T. Theiss
Reviews.Content: I bouth this to avoid carrying my laptop on day trips.  Does everything I need, calendar share, email, video, video phone (wirelessly); albeit somewhat slowly.  I've gotten into some games and I like having the opportunity to pass the time on a plane with solitare, crosswords, sudoko or a more modern video game.  I wish the battery lasted longer, but it does make over two hours if use isn't too intensive.  One sad thing, the mini USB is on top and the cabble stick up a lot.  After being battered over time, it quit.  I guess you can deal with it by unplugging anytime you are not actively using it, but that  is not convenient.  Not a big deal, but it was nice to have an external keyboard sometimes.

Reviews.Title: quit working after a month
Reviews.Author: mary elaine shafer
Reviews.Content: was real nice at first but quit working after a month of 1 hour a day uses just wouldnt turn on....was fast and held alot of apps  thow

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Steven Presley
Reviews.Content: The screen went dead after about six weeks. It has a matrix look to it and nothing we did changed it

Reviews.Title: WORST TABLET AND SELLER EVER!
Reviews.Author: bizceh
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet because it comes with a stylus and the reviews were alright. I thought I could use the stylus to write and sketch with... but NO! It doesn't even write properly and has a mind of its own. When I write a curve, it makes a straight line and does its own thing. You have to push hard to get anything on the screen, but it skip lines most of the time... very frustrating, as if I'm writing a secret formula of some sort or an alien writing an unknown language from outer space.What's irony, is that the seller (Goodios) want's to charge me a re-stocking fee if I return it (that was the first threat when I contacted them after a week), as if I was rough with it or I'm gonna return it with missing parts. They didn't even bother to offer and pay for the postage. I didn't want to go through that cause some companies will find anything wrong with anything to avoid paying you the full amount, and I dealt with those dishonest once before. I tried to hold on to it and made it work properly, but to no avail (it was totally a lemon and I kept telling them that... still they never offer to pay for the postage). I didn't like the tablet anymore cause of those issues, and the brand was faulty. I bought it cause it had some favorable reviews on that tablet and the stylus to use, but mine was a mistake, a total crap, and the seller was a total jerk for threatening me... I mean, I wanted to return it because it's not working like it should have, and I have to pay for it (GIVE ME A BREAK)???"SOMETHING'S WRONG WITH THE TABLET AND YOU HAVE TO RE-BOOT IT SEVERAL TIMES BEFORE IT FUNCTIONS A LITTLE, NOT EVEN WELL ENOUGH".THE BATTERY POWER SUCKS TOO, CAUSE IT EATS UP THE SYSTEM WAY TOO SOON AND WAY TOO FAST!You can't even use it right using your own hand and it was a struggle to even swipe the screen, unlike my other tablet (smooth as a whistle and carefree), and to struggle with the seller, forget it... I will give them a poor rating for the threat and poor service. They should have accepted the return and refunded my money for bad item and poor service.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: Pamela Cranfill "dktagirl"
Reviews.Content: I found the tablet to be extremely slow, the screen is very sensitive to direction and the camera quality is grainy.  I'm sending it back and thankfully Amazon has a great return policy.

Reviews.Title: Terrible!
Reviews.Author: tykia
Reviews.Content: this this has a mind of its own. it freezes up all the time. windows open and shut whenever they want. terrible.

Reviews.Title: Zeepad very nice
Reviews.Author: Sabina M Noel
Reviews.Content: The first two I received were broken but the third one was a charm. My son is loving his Zeepad

Reviews.Title: Charger that is included doesn't fit in the unit.
Reviews.Author: K W
Reviews.Content: There is a charger than comes with the unit, however, it does not fit not charge the unit and you have to purchase the correct charger in order to use.

Reviews.Title: ugh
Reviews.Author: Tonisha Houston
Reviews.Content: i never knew how to operate this thing and the sound on it was horrible. I could have it on the max volume level and I still had to strain to hear something.

Reviews.Title: Granddaughters lovr them.

Reviews.Title: Ya get what ya pay for.....

Reviews.Title: Didnt work from day one.
Reviews.Author: shadwina
Reviews.Content: I would rate a zero if I could, it did not work from day one, I charged it per the directions and it came on but cut right off, I tried to turn it on again by holding the button for two minutes as directed, it came on but went off again within a few minutes, I got this for my daughter as a christmas present and had to send it back. The camera has flash (I was surprised at that) and there is a front and rear facing camera. I know its only 4gigs so that doesnt matter all you need is a mini sd.I have to order one of these for my self just to have being that they are only $63....when i was loading the games the tablet did reset and stay on the welcome screen but after I pluged in the charged it continued to load. I hope this isnt a problem that he will encounter alot.But none the less I will be purchasing another! Maybe a pink one becuase even though my husband has his own 10" tab he likes new stuff! -____- Now that im thinking about it my 6 and 5 year old girls having a pink tablet might draw there attention o.0

One started showing the script that runs in the background on the screen in the foreground and the others screen cracked far too easily.  You get what you pay for I guess.

Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son and within a month it was not working right.  I wasn't able to understand the instruction guide very well when trying to fix it.  Resetting it just seemed to make things worse.

Reviews.Author: satisfied customer
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this tablet. Purchased for my little computer genius, only to have it freeze, not take a charge, and just completely give up and die. The screen was never clear. Locating warranty information was useless.

Reviews.Title: The best investment that I have made for my grandson who just turned 2 on Nov 1st.
Reviews.Author: Gail Forsythe
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandson who  just turned 2 on Nov 1st. I had already taught him his numbers 0 - 9, basic colors, 7 shapes, and 30 sign languages. I was trying to figure out how to teach him the alphabet. One day we had the magnetic letters and he told me 7 of the letters correctly. He now knows about 1/2 of the alphabet and it's from an APP that I downloaded on his tablet. He had several educational apps on it, including flashcards. He is learning different vegetables, body parts, instruments, animals, along with other information that a child of the age of 2, usually does not learn. The only problem is, the battery runs down too fast. It is though, very well built for even a 2 year old, although he is monitored with it and does not just carry it around without supervision.

Reviews.Title: Good buy.
Reviews.Author: P. Manley "book lover"
Reviews.Content: I would give this a five but the sound is very weak.  I got this for my toddler grand daughter so she would leave my galaxy tablet alone.  It was cheaper than the kids tablets and works just as well.  She still prefers mine tablet when watching videos because the sound on this one is so weak but other than that, we love it.  And since we have had it a few months and it's being used my a 2 1/2 year old--I would have to say it is sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Terrible product
Reviews.Content: Very cheaply made! The on and off button as well as the sound button  came off! The device freezes and also takes a long time to load!Would not recommend this, defiantly wasted my money since we only had it a couple weeks

Reviews.Title: My wasted money down the drain and I can't even get any results to help recoup my money are new tablets....Will never buy tablet
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: It stopped working and I bought 2 of the one for my grandaughter and one for me, hers stopped working 3 months ago and mine 2 months ago.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: Michael Wells Glueck "EditAndPublishYourBook.com"
Reviews.Content: I agree with reviewers who found the Wi-Fi reception weak or intermittent. Sometimes it was necessary to switch to airplane mode while on land or sea. And it wasn't always possible to enter words in a search box. Finally, the battery lasts for only one hour before requiring recharging and causing the tablet to shut down automatically. I bought and sold this tablet within four days. Enough said?

Reviews.Title: Junk.  Pure junk.
Reviews.Author: Salty
Reviews.Content: Returning this tomorrow.  Perhaps I'm just spoiled by my previous tablet, that sadly quit charging, but this is a piece of junk. I found that the screen was impossible to change the settings.  I first thought it was the brightness, but had my bf check it out, and he couldn't fix it so it looked even halfway normal.  It's the slowest ever when attempting to open a browser to the internet.  We messed around with googling quite a few sites, and found that our patience just ran out.  Even attempting to play Candy Crush on this messed with our eyes and minds.  The gems moved at a snails pace, and the colors were so skewed, we just quit.  Rather disappointing.  Netflix took forever to load, often stopped to buffer, and the color/brightness/settings were so distorted, it was unwatchable.Not gonna mess with it, perhaps it could just be this unit, but I'm returning it to find a different product that actually has some quality to it.

It may be slow for internet browsing, Android is not the latest and the battery doesn't run too long, but good enough for my use. Transferring files from/to PC is really simple. The price is hard to beat.Only the con is the color (red). For some reason other colors were $10 more expensive, then, red is wonderful.

Reviews.Content: Screen vision is poor.  Browser is slow. The battery run low very fast.  Don't like it at all.  Save your $70 for something better.

He said "NANA,.I love the Graphics and how fast it looks up what I need!...My grandson came to me the other evening ,and said,"Nana, I really like this Zeepad,it is so much better !!! I love watching movies on it, and playing my games."..I knew what was coming!....Guess who has got  the ZEEPAD?...It is going back too Indiana!! I will have to buy another one!  PS...You got grandkids coming???, take my advice and HIDE it! So glad I bought it! "When my Grand kids are happy, I'M HAPPY!!! (They live 800 miles from us)  THANKS AMAZON!  very satisfied with my purchase,,,,you will be getting another order from me soon!

The tablet kept rebooting.  It would not download apps from the Playstore.  The Browser would start to open and then crash.  No GPS either. Totally useless piece of junk.  Sending it back.

Reviews.Title: Ive had this a few months now
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I like this little tablet. Ive had this a few months now and I must say i like it. I read my newspaper on the the subway to work . I read Kindle Books with the kindle app which is great. I also use Google play extensively. I also have the option of using Amazon Apps. Its extremly light the swipe keyboard which makes it fast and easy is availible on Google play. I started with a 2gb micro card but the  more GB you add the faster is moves and less lag time. It takes one minute to boot up.  The camerea is trash but its OK for Skype ....just OK. Hardly a sell or take away point. I dropped it once and its so easy to actually put back together as long as your pieces don't breakn  This was a great find, especilly if you are careless or a teen. I keep thinking I want to get a dedicated Kindle reader but I cant justify it this really takes care of my needs. The Red color makes it look young and sporty

Reviews.Title: Zeepad Tablet

Reviews.Content: Very good gift... We purchased the Zeepad for our 8 year old daughters birthday back mid May of this year and she loves it... It's been an awesome starter tablet.. You can download just about anything from the android appstore and very easy to use... She loves it!

Reviews.Title: Birthday present for 8 year old Girl
Reviews.Author: Sue-Anne Orozco
Reviews.Content: Very good gift... We purchased the Zeepad for our 8 year old daughters birthday back mid May of this year and she loves it... It's been an awesome starter tablet.. You can download just about anything from the android appstore and very easy to use... She loves it!

Reviews.Title: Nice little tablet
Reviews.Author: Chad M. "Chad"
Reviews.Content: I wanted something inexpensive for my 5 year old, he is too advanced for the normal "kid" tablets, meaning he is used to navigating android phones and other tablets.  I have only had it 2 days but so far its exactly what i need.  His last one was a bit more expensive, and even with a screen protector and a big case, he broke it.  So far this tablet is better than that one, meaning faster and able to handle movies without having to change the file type etc...and if it breaks, its 1/3 of the cost of most other tablets, plus his favorite color is red so that added to the excitement.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Zuhair Baker
Reviews.Content: For a tablet that cost about $80 it is great slow but for your kids it is what you should get them they can play watch and it has all Android stuff.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my 4 year old
Reviews.Author: Bryan "hydrophoid"
Reviews.Content: No one is going to love working on this tablet, but at the price point I hope no one is expecting to work on this tablet (you could do some work with it but you would not like it).Overall this is a great tablet for the price. My wife and I debated getting our 4 year old a LeapPad for educational games, but I was able to win out by pointing out the cost of many Android games: free.The screen has a small viewing angle and the resolution isn't the best, my daughter loves playing the ABC and puzzle games we downloaded for her. I have not purchased any software for her, but the free games on Play are awesome. This thing even runs Candy Crush (just in case you were wondering :).I wish this didn't have a proprietary charging end on it (it has a USB port, but that is not for charging) but my other tablets also have proprietary charging ports so it seems to be standard for them to make a different port.The box was full of goodies: charging cable, usb adapter (so you can plug in full sized usb items to the tablet), a stylus, AND a screen protector. They really delivered on the packaging.This tablet is really a bargain for the price, it wont win any processor speed awards and it can hang at times but if you are in the same boat and looking for something to entertain your children during long drives or you want to use some type of electronic game/learning system this is priced to be in your top 5 list of purchase considerations. On the other hand, if you are an adult looking for something to surf the web/look for jobs/ do any type of professional work with, I would suggest a different more powerful (and likely expensive) tablet.Willie-B

Reviews.Title: Great for kids
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "JT"
Reviews.Content: This is great for my grandson with downs syndrome. He broke the glass and they even repaired it for $20.00

Reviews.Title: Teenage daughter loves it.
Reviews.Author: MommaFoo
Reviews.Content: My daughter especially loves the front-facing camera and uses it to Skype with her friends.  Does the same and more as my Kindle.  She's had it a few weeks now and so far so good!

Reviews.Title: Was the quality of this item above or below your expectations
Reviews.Author: María Eusebia Díaz Guerrero
Reviews.Content: The product is brand is not offered in the notice, did not bring security, did not bring the manual or the bonus offered in the bid. All this calls into question its quality and durability.

Reviews.Title: Great Kids Tablet, Okay Quality, Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought four (yes, 4) of these for my kids for Christmas 2012. So they have been through more than six months of regular use. For $70 these are pretty good. They are definitely not iPads, Google Nexus, or Samsung Galaxies, but they are a good buy for your average 4 to 8 year olds. At this point, three of the four are still working and two of the four are working well. They work well for playing games, reading ebooks, watching movies, or taking silly (albeit low quality) pictures of oneself. They do all this just as well a Nexus.About two months ago one the tablets stopped charging, the battery still had a small charge (not enough to power up) and the charger was working. Something stopped working in the charging circuits on the motherboard. So that one is no longer usable.All but one of the chargers has stopped working, I think the wire or plug is too weak and broke, they worked if you wiggled the plug. Also the charging receptacle in the tablets is weak, one tablet's does not work anymore. And the USB port of another does not work. This has probably as much to do with the kids jamming and yanking on the cord, as anything.Fortunately, the USB connector does charge the tablet, so even without any of the chargers you can still use the tablets.The third tablet is very slow to react when tapping on the screen. This is most noticeable on the home screen, but also when playing games, though not as bad.Very odd, seems more of a software based problem than hardware.The fourth tablet, so far (knock on wood) is working fine no problems at all. Battery life has never been that great, two hours or so max. It hasn't diminished in six months so they are good quality, just not that big. Keep a smart phone charger on hand and they will last as long as you've got gas in the car.Overall, I am pleased with these tablet. Especially for younger kids, when you don't want to throw a lot of money down the drain (literally!) Trust me, I know, before they got these, my wife's Nexus, ended up in the toilet when two kids tried to grab it at the same time. Fortunately, it still works fine.We know they can take care of them now, so we will upgrade them one at a time, as they stop working. So far only one has had to be replaced. Pretty good as far as I'm concerned.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: nikkih
Reviews.Content: I bought this item for my seven year old son for his birthday. I did not want to put a lot of money in it being I was afraid that he will drop it. After reading reviews after reviews I bought it. This is perfect for him. I have not had any problems with it freezing up. While he has an account for g.c. to buy games there are plenty of free games and books.  The stylus has already torn. It has a rubber bottom that is used on the screen and it has come apart. No big deal use your fingers. There are no set parental controls on it, but my husband went on google and manually set controls for graphic material. So you can set controls it just takes a bit to do. THe battery isn't as long as an Ipad or other high end tablets, but that is a positive in my book. It usually last a good hr to hour and half of active use.  Overall I believe this is a good buy for a kid to have a tablet. If he breaks it I feel like I don't have a ton of money in it.
